title: Marriage and Family Therapist Trainee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews, including one group interview and an individual interview. The group interview is longer, about 1 hour, and the individual interview is very short, about 15 minutes. Questions are about personal strengths, faith integration, personal background, etc.
Interview Questions: How do you see the integration of Christian faith and psychotherapy?

title: Mock Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California Baptist University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went great. I had Lisa and she was so warm and welcoming. She asked tough questions and treated me like a real person interviewing for a job. We ended up having tons of fun and she gave great constructive criticism. She said I was hirable in the end!
Interview Questions: What is a tough decision you had to make this year?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the head of hiring and talked about what contributions I could make, my experiences, and who I am as a person. It goes very smoothly and the person interviewing does not apply too much stress.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this position?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Not a special interview. Typical questions and answers. You don't have much to prepare. You will be asked questions about the church and faith. The interview itself is not very important here.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply here?

title: Undergraduate Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: A couple of steps, meet with directors and assistant director, then dean, then president. Fairly simple and straight-forward. You may have to do a presentation, but that depends on the candidate
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses? How do you do in team dynamics?

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at California Baptist University in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. Discussed faith and the importance of it within a instructor setting and asked if active within a Christian church. Walked through a few possible scenarios that may arise when teaching and how you would respond.
Interview Questions: How would you respond when a student is questioning the grading of an assignment?

title: Customer Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pre-covid, group interview setting with 3 other interviewees. Four staff conducted the interview. Standard questions and relaxed environment made the interview easy as a whole. Questions were asked uniquely to each individual and no questions were asked of the same person twice.
Interview Questions:
What are your best qualities?

Who is your hero?

What is a big mistake you've made?

What do you want out of the job?

title: Underwriter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was contacted a few weeks later, then we set a date. the interview went well, and the interviewer was very reasonable and easy to talk with. they HR reps are generally easy to connect with
Interview Questions: tell us why we should hire you

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Full day interview. It's definitely not for everyone. This institution has very specific traits they are looking for.  You must join a particular church, agree with a particular "theological"interpretation of evolution (unclear if it is creationist or has science mixed in), and abide by a strict code of conduct.  Just my luck, that most interviewers were not interested in me that day.  They were polite and professional, but only one potential colleague was engaged in the interview.
Interview Questions:
Are you okay with doing practically no research? 
Any research you do will be exploratory (ie there is no lab space available currently).

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews over Zoom, one with a lead professor and then another with the Director of the program and a fellow full time professor. Each interview was about an hour long and during it the interview took on a conversation approach.
Interview Questions:
What is your teaching philosophy?
How do you incorporate the Bible and religion into your lessons?
What do you find is the most difficult part of teaching?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Virtual, three interview with different departmental individuals. Very friendly and welcoming, they asked questions about curriculum and teaching philosophy but were patient when I thought out my responses. They prayed before the interview which was very comforting and calming.
Interview Questions:
How will you incorporate God into your lesson plans?
Where do you think your biggest challenge will be, teaching?
What is your best strength in the classroom?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call to schedule a phone interview a week later. The phone interview was just the supervisors asking questions. I never heard back since and assumed I was no longer considered for the position.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Adjuct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied on their website about a month later I got an email to do a phone interview. It was about to be Christmas break when I did the phone interview (only a few days after I got the email response). In January I met with the department chair then a week later with the Dean. They were clear that they were looking for instructors for the following fall so I wasn't expecting to hear back soon.  In June I was offered two classes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach at CBU in particular?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I worked at public safety and the manager took the face-to-face interview. She was really helpful. She asked some behavioral questions and some faith-related questions.  In the last, she asked about my class timing so she can manage my time slots.
Interview Questions: How can you manage the overload at the workplace?

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It really did not have much to it, you just go in and inquire about the job and set up an interview. You only need to think about what role you would like to have.
Interview Questions: What major are you in?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Only a two step process. Wasn't too difficult. It helps if you have connections. The questions weren't overwhelming and strait to the point. Asked me about my life at the beginning and then went strait into asking design related questions.
Interview Questions: Q:What's a difficult time you dealt with. How did you fix it?

title: Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met a spiritual life employer in his office for an informal interview. He asked me if I was on campus and if I could come in. It was a relaxed process and I felt calm and confident.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Notetaker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Looked up job posting on Handshake me brought in documents including my resume and schedule to their office. I was layered emailed a interview date. During the interview she asked me questions based on a document and wrote my answers throughout the interview
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for the job

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was the first job interview of my life and I was quite tensed for the interview process. However, the interview went good and I was not asked too many questions. After two days I was informed that I got selected.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to this position?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with the director of the Campus Store. She was very sweet and i just had to tell her about myself and have a nice conversation. She asked me what I liked to do for fun and just talked about what I wanted to do after school. It was a very easy process and she was very nice to talk to
Interview Questions: So tell me about yourself

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Minimum of two interviews possibly three.  Panel of 8 people on one of the interviews. Months before heard back.  Will always have to meet with President of school before job offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Student Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call for an interview.  It was a group email where we were given a few minutes to plan a activity together and then we individually gave a short presentation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: It was really laid back. I was interviewed by two managers. They asked me only a few questions, and they were both extremely nice. They even told me that this would be a short and easy interview.
Interview Questions: What are a few of my strengths and weaknesses?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: First interview is telephonic.   Very skills focused but also inquires about your religious beliefs and affiliations.   Interviewer was very courteous and professional throughout the exchange.
Interview Questions: Have you read the Southern Baptist Faith message and do you agree?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a group discussion and then followed by an aptitude test. They were testing whether you are really interested in that job and how active are you in expressing yourself.
Interview Questions: They gave me a situation and asked me how would I handle that situation.

title: Customer Service Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Require to send an email describing why you are a good fit for the position and company. Once you passed, you will be called for an interview. Once there, there would be two other persons in the interview, and they will availate you.
Interview Questions: What are three of your strengths

title: Game Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: i very basic question tell me about yourself , do u have any experience , what is your pay in last company , tell me about your role past company, what is your weakness , how you over come it
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself , do you  have any experience , what is your pay in last company , tell me about your role past company, what is your weakness , how you over come it

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: First round interviews are virtual. For second round, prepare for an interview in the department as well as an interview with the president. It will be a quick few questions. For faculty, prepare for a teaching demonstration as well.
Interview Questions:
How do you live your faith?
Are you comfortable living a conservative lifestyle?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hard part was being asked into an interview due to the low number of jobs and high number of applicants. Interview itself was a breeze though. The interview ran more like a conversation than anything else.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what are your favorite things to do on the weekend? Have you ever had any experience in this type of job setting?

title: ITS Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
There are two rounds of interviews: the first is with the HelpDesk Manager and with the Director of User Services. The interview process did not last long, as it was only 15 minutes or so. They primarily asked me about why I was interested in becoming part of their team, and delved a little into my technical experience to see where I would be a good fit.

The second round of interviewing was with the Associate Vice President of Technology and Vice President for Online and Professional Studies. They essentially interviewed to see my character and work-ethic. This was more of a casual conversation about technology and our school in general.
Interview Questions: What experience I've had with technology.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Any student who applies gets the job.  Very easy. Just act normal and keep your schedule open in the mornings.  There will be very generic questions in the interview like: what are you strengths and weaknesses....
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Public Safety

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: You meet with the assistant to the dean and is more about hearing your experience and learning about your personality. This job requires you to be constantly friendly and in the know, VP's come in, prospective students visit, and of course current student are coming to ask questions. You have to be kind and comfortable talking a bunch of strangers all day, they assistant likes to talk to you to gauge that.
Interview Questions: Are you a graduate student? How would you handle multiple calls coming in while students are also coming in to ask questions?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions: Interview in person with Department Head and 2 team members. The interview questions weren't difficult and the office was very friendly and answered all of my questions. Unfortunately, the time it took for the HR office to offer me the position was too long and I had already accepted another job.
Interview Questions: I don't recall any difficult questions.

title: Safety Services Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at California Baptist University
Interview Descriptions:
You meet with the department director and reviews your qualification.
Meet with Dean of student and Vice President on background and beliefs. 
Meet with the President asks questions about you.
Interview Questions: If a student asked you about God, what would you say that also coincides with the Universities Statement of Faith?

title: Online Instructor - Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Written application; Skype interview. The rest of the words here have been entered in order to meet the 50 word minimum. It was a standard interview format preceded by an online IT test and test of abilities to work online.
Interview Questions: In my area of academic expertise, what school of thought did I adhere or support to the most?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Three part process. Application, Group Processing (large and small group activities), and Panel Interview (one applicant and 2-3 current staff and RA.
Interview Questions: How are you prepared to handle this position?

title: Undergraduate Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at California Baptist University in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Application, phone call, interview.
Interview Questions: What would make you different from anyone else I would hire with your experience?

title: Access Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at California Baptist University (Riverside, CA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Had a friend recommend me for the job, interviewed with director, then dean, the president before hired. It was difficult to schedule initial interview because the director didn't seem interested in filling the position
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in furthering your education to fill one of the open Librarian positions?
